The bill signed into law by Gov: Scott Walker in Wisconsin requiring women to get an ultrasound before getting an abortion.
Rachel Campos: Duffy, a conservative pundit and wife of U.S. Rep. Sean Duffy, making a statement about ultrasounds and abortion at a Wisconsin Right to Life gathering.
Comments made by senators: including a Republican claiming that abortions "became the thing to do" in the 1960s and a Democrat stating that the bill was government intrusion into a woman's body.
The source of Campos: Duffy's claim, which she stated was the Knights of Columbus, a Catholic group that helps bring ultrasound machines to "pro-life pregnancy help centers."
